intro: Gerbera latiligulata, commonly known as the narrow-lipped gerbera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Gerbera latiligulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for. It blooms throughout the growing season, adding vibrant color to landscapes.
